channel.title: Comments on: Are J, E, P & D your favorite letters?
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Jon
item.dc:creator: Jon
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/05/19/are-j-e-p-d-your-favorite-letters/#comment-3084">chakira</a>.
It's from the post about the Brooklyn Jew who asked "who is Zeus?" on that Passover tour in Crete.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to chakira.

It’s from the post about the Brooklyn Jew who asked “who is Zeus?” on that Passover tour in Crete.

item.title: By: AW
item.dc:creator: AW
item.description: Ouch! Russian Haskalah cut off from actual academic trends in Germany! I'll try to get over that one. But from whence the inference that I am unaware of the academic Bible scholars in our midst? As for the title, all my TeaneckShuls posts have humorous titles; no reason this one shouldn't. I was toying with "Knohl, Kaufmann, Kugel and Gunkel" but decided to go for something that was a) more basic and b) didn't sound like a law firm, since business posts are generally prohibited on TeaneckShuls and that might have held up the posting.
item.content:encoded: Ouch! Russian Haskalah cut off from actual academic trends in Germany! I’ll try to get over that one. But from whence the inference that I am unaware of the academic Bible scholars in our midst? As for the title, all my TeaneckShuls posts have humorous titles; no reason this one shouldn’t. I was toying with “Knohl, Kaufmann, Kugel and Gunkel” but decided to go for something that was a) more basic and b) didn’t sound like a law firm, since business posts are generally prohibited on TeaneckShuls and that might have held up the posting.

item.title: By: AS
item.dc:creator: AS
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/05/19/are-j-e-p-d-your-favorite-letters/#comment-3084">chakira</a>.
Soon to join the pantheon of catchphrases along with "I'll get you next time Achilles!" and "Ares? There goes the neighborhood!"
item.content:encoded:
In reply to chakira.

Soon to join the pantheon of catchphrases along with “I’ll get you next time Achilles!” and “Ares? There goes the neighborhood!”

item.title: By: IH
item.dc:creator: IH
item.description:
"the vast majority of frum Jews do not associate anything with those letters."
Who is Zeus?
item.content:encoded:
“the vast majority of frum Jews do not associate anything with those letters.”

Who is Zeus?

item.title: By: SQ
item.dc:creator: SQ
item.description: Perhaps the subject line was oblique as a way of getting the email past the TeaneckShuls moderators, who might not catch the meaning of the letters. I know for a fact (I checked) that the vast majority of frum Jews do not associate anything with those letters.
item.content:encoded: Perhaps the subject line was oblique as a way of getting the email past the TeaneckShuls moderators, who might not catch the meaning of the letters. I know for a fact (I checked) that the vast majority of frum Jews do not associate anything with those letters.
